properties.description: swith threading of reads and protocol parsing

properties.description: I/O threads

properties.label: maxmemory-percent
properties.description: Max memory percent Redis can make use of.

properties.label: disabled-commands_label
properties.description: disabled-commands_description

properties.label: requirepass
properties.description: Require clients to issue AUTH <PASSWORD> before processing any other commands.

properties.label: activerehashing
properties.description: Active rehashing uses 1 millisecond every 100 milliseconds of CPU time in order to help rehashing the main Redis hash table

properties.label: appendonly
properties.description: The Append Only File is an alternative persistence mode that provides much better durability.

properties.label: appendfsync
properties.description: It tells the Operating System to actually write data on disk instead of waiting for more data in the output buffer.

properties.label: cluster-allow-pubsubshard-when-down
properties.description: This option, when set to yes, allows nodes to serve pubsub shard traffic while the cluster is in a down state, as long as it believes it owns the slots.

properties.label: cluster-node-timeout
properties.description: Cluster node timeout is the amount of milliseconds a node must be unreachable for it to be considered in failure state

properties.label: cluster-link-sendbuf-limit
properties.description: Cluster link send buffer limit is the limit on the memory usage of an individual cluster bus link%27s send buffer in bytes.

properties.label: latency-monitor-threshold
properties.description: It samples different operations at runtime in order to collect data related to possible sources of latency of a Redis instance.

properties.label: maxclients
properties.description: Set the max number of connected clients at the same time.

properties.label: maxmemory-policy
properties.description: The eviction policy to remove keys when the memory limit is reached.

properties.label: maxmemory-samples
properties.description: LRU and minimal TTL algorithms are not precise algorithms but approximated algorithms (in order to save memory), using this to tune it for speed or accuracy.

properties.label: maxmemory-clients
properties.description: A memory value can be used for the client eviction threshold

properties.label: min-replicas-max-lag
properties.description: A master stops accepting writes if there are less than N slaves connected, having a lag less or equal than M seconds.

properties.label: min-replicas-to-write
properties.description: A master stops accepting writes if there are less than N slaves connected, having a lag less or equal than M seconds.

properties.label: no-appendfsync-on-rewrite
properties.description: It prevents fsync() from being called in the main process while a BGSAVE or BGREWRITEAOF is in progress.

properties.label: notify-keyspace-events
properties.description: It selects the events that Redis will notify among a set of classes.

properties.label: repl-backlog-size
properties.description: Set the replication backlog size.

properties.label: repl-backlog-ttl
properties.description: It configures the amount of seconds that need to elapse, starting from the time the last slave disconnected, for the backlog buffer to be freed.

properties.label: repl-timeout
properties.description: It is the replication timeout.

properties.label: slowlog-log-slower-than
properties.description: It logs queries that exceeded a specified execution time.

properties.label: slowlog-max-len
properties.description: It logs queries with the length of the slow log.

properties.label: tcp-keepalive
properties.description: TCP keepalive between server and client.

properties.label: timeout
properties.description: Close the connection after a client is idle for N seconds (0 to disable).

properties.label: shutdown-timeout
properties.description: Maximum time to wait for replicas when shutting down, in seconds.

properties.label: set-max-intset-entries
properties.description: It sets the limit in the size of the set in order to use this special memory saving encoding.

properties.label: list-max-listpack-size
properties.description: Small lists are encoded in a special way in order to save a lot of space.

properties.label: hash-max-listpack-entries
properties.description: Hashes are encoded using a memory efficient data structure when they have a small number of entries

properties.label: hash-max-listpack-value
properties.description: Hashes are encoded using a memory efficient data structure when they have a small number of entries, and the biggest entry does not exceed a given threshold

properties.label: zset-max-listpack-entries
properties.description: Sorted sets are specially encoded in order to save a lot of space.

properties.label: zset-max-listpack-value
properties.description: Sorted sets are specially encoded in order to save a lot of space.

properties.label: lua-time-limit
properties.description: Max execution time of a Lua script in milliseconds.
